page.title: 19ANSTY MAYPOLE NEAR WARDOUR
page.content: The{Ansty Maypole}stands next to the {Maypole Inn.}It is the{highest}Maypole in{England.}We measured it our selves but we checked with the Saw mill owner.The pole stands{103}feet high. {Mr Ridley}put the Maypole in the ground with the help of five men. It is made from a{Douglas fir.}To keep it secure the men planted it seven feet in the ground. Placed on the top is a{weather vane.}The whole village 0wns it and on Ansty May{(May 1st) people come and feast and fair along with dancing though the{Maypole}is so tall that the ribbons often get twisted so that it is hard to dance. Nobody knows when the first maypole was put up but we do know it was taken down in{1644}by an act of{Oliver {Cromwell's}parliament.{King Charles allowed it to be put back in{1660. {Charlotte and Christabel
